query:
Store as Studio:
How retail stores are becoming content properties
title: Holiday Flagship Early-Access & Pop-up Tests · 2025-11-19 → 2025-11-26 · Run 20251126-135547
highlights: Concentrated early-access windows create scarcity and content assets that lift weekend foot traffic and conversion, converting event attention into measurable sales.
A/B framing isolates markdown-driven traffic versus bundle+GWP+loyalty-driven spend and margin; the leverage point sits in offer architecture and timing.
Measurement must tie door counts, QR scans, and QR→POS attribution to control CPA and validate the early-window share target.
executive_summary: We will run a unified holiday target pack across early-access windows and pop-up labs to drive measurable store-side performance. Targets: foot-traffic uplift **10–15%** (stretch **≥25%** in top markets), early-window transaction share **20–30%** (vs ~12–15% baseline), event CPA ≤**0.80×** baseline, and QR/scan redemption ≥**5%** of footfall. The test frames Arm A as legacy markdown versus Arm B as bundle plus GWP plus loyalty inside the same two-week window to isolate attention versus price effects. Collaboration teams must lock inventory windows, instrument door counts and QR→POS links, configure the A/B holdout, and route analytics to daily ops reviews within **30 days**. [^1][^3][^7]
top_operator_moves: Stand up the two-week A/B holdout now: Arm A legacy markdown; Arm B bundle + GWP + loyalty. Lock inventory SKUs and traffic windows for both arms.
Instrument measurement immediately: door counts or proxy, QR→POS linking, event-specific SKUs, and daily CPA tracking fed to an ops review.
Build a repeatable pop-up lab playbook: a rolling calendar of creator-led studio days and ticketed micro-events that produce short-form assets for paid and owned channels.
